head.supplied: Melbourne bot Garden ¶ 27/3/73 ¶ ¶ I am much interested in the notice ¶ of the plants of Kilimanjaro, dear Professor Balfour, as I worked on the alpine vegetation of Australia. Will any publication ...

div.p: Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh, J. H. Balfour correspondence, vol. X, f. 277.

I am much interested in the notice
A clipping from the Journal of Botany, British and Foreign, new series, vol. 2, 1873, containing a report of the meeting of the Botanical Society of Edinburgh on 12 December 1872, is bound with this letter. The meeting heard that ' Dr. John Kirk, Zanzibar, presented to the University [of Edinburgh] Herbarium a collection of dried plants from the highest zone of vegetation in the Kilimanjaro, below the line of perpetual snow that crowns the summit' (p. 94). of the plants of Kilimanjaro, dear Professor Balfour, as I worked on the alpine vegetation of Australia. Will any publication of this rare alpine treasure soon appear? Thanking you for your kind continuance of sending prints I remain your regardful

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
